bug.author: algattik
bug.summary: Sample with Webservice(ws, service_name) does not work
bug.description:
Sample with Webservice(ws, service_name) does not work: <denchmark-code> service = Webservice(ws, service_name) File "lib/python3.7/site-packages/azureml/core/webservice/webservice.py", line 192, in __new__ return super(Webservice, cls).__new__(cls) TypeError: Can't instantiate abstract class Webservice with abstract methods _deploy, get_token, run, update </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: 045c9469-5ed5-3435-49f6-6374202fbe01 Version Independent ID: 9b483196-0666-e292-dc6a-c4f5d6454942 Content: azureml.core.Webservice class - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-core/azureml.core.Webservice(class).yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @j-martens Microsoft Alias: jmartens

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/algattik>@algattik</denchmark-link>
Thanks for the feedback! I have assigned the issue to the content author to investigate further and update the document as appropriate.

I just ran both notebooks referenced in <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/python/api/azureml-core/azureml.core.webservice%28class%29?view=azure-ml-py#remarks>Webservice</denchmark-link> class remarks class and they worked. The samples in the remarks are extracts from the notebooks and run only with the context provided in the notebook.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/algattik>@algattik</denchmark-link> Thanks for your report. Since we haven't heard back from you in awhile, I will proceed to close this issue. If you feel that your issue has not been resolved, please reopen the issue and provide additional context.
